instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.BKL_SDA: What is BKL_SDA? BKL_SDA is an SMBUS data line between the LED driver and the system management controller(SMC).
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that has no backlight.

Already replace <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, but with no success.

I get 8.6V on F7700 and 8.6V on <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>, but no backlight.
I get 3.3V on <RESISTOR>R7757</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>BKL_SDA</SIGNAL>
I get 3.3V on <RESISTOR>R7753</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>BKL_SCL</SIGNAL>
I get 2.8V on <RESISTOR>R7715</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>
All return resistance seams to be ok.
Can it be feedback? How to be sure?

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message:
I suppose you already check to confirm image is present.
It should be, as you get 8.6V at <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>.

Did you check XW7720 bridge continuity?
What about <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> level?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message:
HI,
I do have image, but i didn't checked  XW7720  nor  <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL>...

On  <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL>  i have 1.46V

How can i measure XW7720  bridge continuity?

P.S. <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT_FB</SIGNAL> test point (near <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>) seams to be corroded.

threads.message: It seams that i don't have  XW7720  bridge continuity
